Summary: Two sightings of teardrop shaped silvery object at different times of day, same day.

divs: sighting detailsthe following report is from notes made shortly after the events. the notes\incidents cited were previously submitted to the old nicap organization back in the 1960s. fyi ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ i was waiting for the high school bus the first time i saw it. i was outside, facing west. suddenly, i noticed a small object about 15 degrees above the horizon, shaped like a tear drop on its side, the large end appearing to be the nose of it as it led the in the direction of travel. it was of a silvery luster and heading slowly in a northwesterly direction in what seemed a deliberate manner like an aircraft might. i have no idea the distance but its apparent size was about the size of a large pin head held at arm's length. i was able to watch it for about 15 minutes as it slowly moved south to north until it disappeared behind some obscuring trees. later that same day, at about 4 pm, i was riding a bicycle home from a friend's when i once again saw the same object, at about the same size and sitting quite still in a north westerly position at about the same elevation as in the morning. i could not keep my eyes on it all the time while riding the bike and within just a few minutes, it suddenly vanished and i never saw it again. key things which made it seem odd to me were that it had this teardrop on its side shape with no apparent wings, stabilizers or any other appendages. no smoke, no flashes of light, and no noise. also, during the second sighting, it held absolutely still in relation to the ground and other objects in my line of sight, yet the wind was blowing pretty hard and obviously making the trees at ground level move. that made me think it was some sort of controlled aircraft or something not at the whim of the winds. i had seen previously war surplus barrage balloons and weather balloons and this did not bounce around in the wind like they would have. however, probably the most remarkable thing about these two sightings was that as you looked at this object, it seemed to always have the same silvery luster to it. i have compared its color and sheen to that which a new nickel has. the truly odd part is that it looked no different to me when the sun shone on it from the east in the morning, than it appeared to me in the afternoon with the late afternoon sun shining on it from the west. in the morning, i would have expected it to be bright and shiny because i was between the sun and it. in the afternoon, however, it was between myself and the sun and the side i saw should have been in shadow and relatively less bright, but it did not seem so. i don't know if that indicates an innate luminosity, but regardless, it seemed a bit different than what i had observed watching aluminum skinned aircraft in similar lighting situations.
